page.title: 15Harbour and Fishing
page.content: When a boat based in Scarborough leaves the harbour the lighthouse keeper checks its departure and return. If one fails to return the {coast guard}is alerted. The Scarborough fishing fleet is made up of{trawlers,}which stay out for nearly a week, and{potters}which just go out for the day. The fishing industry is dying out because of{competition}from foreign countries such as Norway, Germany and Denmark. The{fish market is held every Thursday morning after the boats have landed their catch. Then the{buyers}and{auctioneers}arrive and the sale starts, finishing around dinner-time. Over the past three years prices have risen enormously, and today the most expensive fish are flat fish. The{yachting harbour}is also important and there is a gun on the lighthouse used to start races.
